item.description: Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#0276; 05:40AM; EB 10 Fwy East of Creshaw Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/2OMPorQ; #MidCity; Multi-Vehicle collision with 2 vehicles overturned. 3 Patients total: 2 in critical condition, 1 fatality at scene. #LATraffic: Closure of one or more lanes until CHP / Caltrans operations are complete, unknown duration. Motorists, expect congestion and delay, avoid the immediate area and consider an alternate route. Detours are readily available. Monitor traffic reports on news radio. Media Inquiries; CHP Central LA Log #488 and Coroner.; FS 68; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E294 E34 E68 EM11 RA34 RA68 RA94 T94; CH4; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0675; 02:15PM; 235 E 29th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HkYpAT; #HistoricSouthCentral; Due to the structure's significant instability and collapse, which thankfully caused no injury, dozens of LAFD firefighters will remain at the scene through this evening to comb through tons of smoldering debris, salvage personal belongings and fully extinguish compartmentalized flames. Displaced by the blaze and now being assisted by the American Red Cross are five members of one family (4 adults and 1 child). The fire's cause has been determined to be electrical in nature.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 E10 E14 E20 E210 E215 E226 EA1 EM11 RA46 RA810 RA9 SQ21 T10 T15 T26 T9; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown Structure Fire; INC#0675; 01:10PM; 235 E 29th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HkYpAT; #HistoricSouthCentral; 65 LAFD Firefighters took just 1 hour, 55 minutes in largely defensive operations to access, confine and extinguish heavy fire found in the attic of a 1,454 square foot one-story home (built 1910), that led to extensive structural collapse, beginning within 10 minutes of LAFD arrival. No injuries reported to (undetermined number) occupants, or firefighters. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 E10 E14 E20 E210 E215 E226 EA1 EM11 RA46 RA810 RA9 SQ21 T10 T15 T26 T9; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update Structure Fire; INC#0675; 11:27AM; 235 E 29th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HkYpAT; #HistoricSouthCentral; 49 Firefighters now in defensive firefighting operations against heavy fire in the attic of a 1,454 square foot one-story home (built 1910), that suffered a front gable and interior ceiling collapse within 10 minutes of LAFD arrival. The firefight continues with no injuries reported.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E10 E20 E210 E215 EM11 RA46 RA810 RA9 SQ21 T10 T15 T9; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0675; 11:15AM; 235 E 29th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HkYpAT; #HistoricSouthCentral; PRELIM: One story home with heavy attic fire.; FS 10; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 E10 E210 E215 EM11 RA46 RA810 RA9 SQ21 T10 T15; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown Structure Fire; INC#0443; 09:13AM; 1217 N Soto St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HlwLn2; #BoyleHeights; 42 Firefighters took just 22 minutes to access, confine and extinguish interior and attic fire in a partially occupied one-story home that had been converted into a residential duplex. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E1 E16 E201 E202 E9 RA1 RA2 SQ21 T2 T9; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0443; 08:51AM; 1217 N Soto St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3HlwLn2; #BoyleHeights; PRELIM: Vacant one story home with heavy smoke from the attic.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 E1 E16 E202 E9 RA1 RA2 SQ21 T2 T9; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#1556; 10:26PM; 7320 W Hawthorn Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Xoo29t; Hollywood; All affected units have been fully ventilated and all readings have returned to normal. Occupants are repopulating their units. There were no medical complaints. The welding in one unit appeared to be the source of the hazard. No further details.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E21 E221 E227 E261 E27 E41 EA1 JT1 RA21 RA82 SQ21 T27 T61; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#1556; 09:35PM; 7320 W Hawthorn Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Xoo29t; Hollywood; The LAFD HazMat Squad is on scene assisting with the incident. A total of five units were evacuated with no occupants reporting any medical complaints. A large scale evacuation is not anticipated. The HVAC ducting is still producing high readings for carbon monoxide and it is turned off. The readings of hydrogen cyanide are decreasing but remain detectable in the most heavily affected corner of the building. However, as firefighters move away from those few units, the readings return to normal levels. ; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E21 E221 E227 E261 E27 E41 EA1 JT1 RA21 RA82 SQ21 T27 T61; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart

Toxic Exposure; INC#1556; 07:49PM; 7320 W Hawthorn Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Xoo29t; Hollywood; Firefighters are on scene of a large, 5 story modern center hall apartment building (4 residential over parking). Multiple carbon monoxide alarms activated on the 1st and 2nd occupied floors. Firefighters made entry and the 5-sensor gas monitor indicated the presence of hydrogen cyanide as well as carbon monoxide, predominately in one corner of the building on the 1st occupied floor. Occupants of the three units in the area of highest concentration were evacuated and the units are being ventilated. Additionally, firefighters are evacuating the units above those, on the 2nd occupied floor. All others are being sheltered in place while firefighters continue to check levels in the surrounding units (it is dropping off significantly as they move further down the hall). There were construction workers doing repairs (including welding) on the ducting for the heating/air conditioning in the most affected unit. LAFD Hazardous Materials Squad is responding and consulting with the Incident Commander while enroute. At this time, there are no occupants with medical complaints.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC5 E21 E221 E41 RA21 RA82 SQ21; CH7; 13; Margaret Stewart
